pli-tv-kd21:1.9.1: Ānanda said to the senior monks,
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.2: “At the time of his final extinguishment, the Buddha said to me,
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.3: ‘After my passing away, Ānanda, if the Sangha wishes, it may abolish the lesser training rules.’”
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.4: “But, Ānanda, did you ask the Buddha
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.5: which are the lesser training rules?”
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.9: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the rest are the lesser training rules.”
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.11: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion and the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the rest are the lesser training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.1: At that time Venerable Purāṇa was wandering in the Southern Hills with a large sangha of five hundred monks.
pli-tv-kd21:1.11.2: When the senior monks had concluded the communal recitation of the Teaching and the Monastic Law, and when Purāṇa had stayed in the Southern Hills for as long as he liked, he went to the Bamboo Grove at Rājagaha. pli-tv-kd21:1.15.1: Ānanda then went to Ghosita’s Monastery, where he sat down on a prepared seat.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.2: Venerable Channa approached Ānanda, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.4: “Channa, the Sangha has imposed the supreme penalty on you.”
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.7: the monks should not correct you, instruct you, or teach you.”
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.8: Saying, “I’m ruined!” he fainted on the spot.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.9: Being troubled, ashamed, and disgusted by the supreme penalty, Channa stayed by himself, secluded, heedful, energetic, and diligent.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.10: And in this very life, he soon realized with his own insight the supreme goal of the spiritual life for which people from good families rightly go forth from home to homelessness.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.12: He understood that birth had come to an end, that the spiritual life had been lived, that the job had been done, that there was no further state of existence.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.13: And Venerable Channa became one of the perfected ones.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.14: He then went to Ānanda and said,
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.15: “Venerable Ānanda, please lift the supreme penalty.”
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.16: “The moment you realized perfection, the supreme penalty was lifted.”
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.1: At this communal recitation of the Monastic Law there were five hundred monks, neither more nor less.
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.2: For this reason this communal recitation is called “The group of five hundred”.
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.3: The eleventh chapter on the group of five hundred is finished. In this chapter there are twenty-three topics.
